qas.question: Who declared Chinese South Africans as "Black People"?

answers.text: the High Court in South Africa

qas.question: What year did this ruling happen?

answers.text: solely for the purposes of accessing affirmative action benefits

qas.question: What Chinese people did not qualify for benefits?

answers.text: Chinese people who arrived in the country after the end of apartheid

qas.question: Why did some Chinese citizens qualify for benefits?

answers.text: they were also "disadvantaged" by racial discrimination.

context: In <a1_0>2008<a1_0/>, <a0_0>the High Court in South Africa<a0_0/> ruled that Chinese South Africans who were residents during the apartheid era (and their descendants) are to be reclassified as "Black people," <a2_0>solely for the purposes of accessing affirmative action benefits<a2_0/>, because <a4_0>they were also "disadvantaged" by racial discrimination.<a4_0/> <a3_0>Chinese people who arrived in the country after the end of apartheid<a3_0/> do not qualify for such benefits.
